text: Lee Richard Adams (born August 15, 1924) is an American musician who writes the words for songs. Those are called lyrics and he is a "lyricist". He worked with Charles Strouse. Strouse made the music for All in the Family and Adams made the lyrics for the theme in the television program. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:American songwriters Category:Lyricists Category:Musicians from Ohio Category:Living people
title: Lee Adams
